name: Newfie Rice Pudding
author: Cathy
summary: A yummy, custard-like rice pudding that will remind you of home if you grew up in Newfoundland. I was searching for years and upon guidance from my aunt and some tested recipes, I fine-tuned a yummy result! Eat this pudding as is or top with whipped cream, tin of cream, or milk to your liking.
ingredients: 1 (12 ounce) can evaporated milk (such as Carnation ®)
directions: Preheat oven to 350 degrees F (175 degrees C)
Whisk rice, evaporated milk, raisins, eggs, white sugar, brown sugar, custard powder, and vanilla extract together in a bowl; pour into the prepared dish
Bake in the preheated oven until a knife inserted into the center of pudding comes out clean, about 30 minutes
